texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I love learning about the  behind the scenes  aspects of just about everything. I do  ham radio , I self-host lots of my personal infrastructure, and I've been learning more about the math behind the stock market for the last year or two.
texts.text: I love learning about the  behind the scenes  aspects of just about everything. I do  ham radio , I self-host lots of my personal infrastructure, and I've been learning more about the math behind the stock market for the last year or two.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: That led me to start a blog on  Ghost  to share my findings with others. I started  Theta Nerd [^what_theta] earlier this summer.
texts.text: That led me to start a blog on  Ghost  to share my findings with others. I started  Theta Nerd [^what_theta] earlier this summer.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: My deployment looked great when I started! Everything was automatically updated with  watchtower  and running with  docker-compose on Fedora CoreOS .  (Click these links to read the posts on both topics!)
texts.text: My deployment looked great when I started! Everything was automatically updated with  watchtower  and running with  docker-compose on Fedora CoreOS .  (Click these links to read the posts on both topics!)

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: However, I woke up one morning to my monitoring going off and my site was down. 😱
texts.text: However, I woke up one morning to my monitoring going off and my site was down. 😱

texts.label: title
texts.orig: Why is the site down?
texts.text: Why is the site down?

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Anyone who has worked in IT knows this sinking feeling. Something is down, you don't know why, and you suspect the worst possible scenarios.
texts.text: Anyone who has worked in IT knows this sinking feeling. Something is down, you don't know why, and you suspect the worst possible scenarios.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The instance hosting the blog was online and responsive, so I started digging into the logs with

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Ah, so a failed database migration in the upgrade to 5.57.2 is the culprit! 👏
texts.text: Ah, so a failed database migration in the upgrade to 5.57.2 is the culprit! 👏

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I brought the site back online quickly by changing the container version for Ghost back to the previous version (5.55.2).
texts.text: I brought the site back online quickly by changing the container version for Ghost back to the previous version (5.55.2).

texts.label: title
texts.orig: Why did the database migration fail?
texts.text: Why did the database migration fail?

texts.label: title
texts.orig: Going upstream
texts.text: Going upstream

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I went to Ghost's GitHub repository and  opened an issue  with as much data as I can find.
texts.text: I went to Ghost's GitHub repository and  opened an issue  with as much data as I can find.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: One of the  first replies  mentioned something about database collations. Long story short, collations describe how databases handle sorting and comparing data for different languages. Comparing some languages to other languages can be particularly challenging and this can lead to problems.
texts.text: One of the  first replies  mentioned something about database collations. Long story short, collations describe how databases handle sorting and comparing data for different languages. Comparing some languages to other languages can be particularly challenging and this can lead to problems.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I made a switch from MariaDB to MySQL recently for the blog. Could that be related?
texts.text: I made a switch from MariaDB to MySQL recently for the blog. Could that be related?

texts.label: title
texts.orig: More searching
texts.text: More searching

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I figured that I wasn't the first one to stumble into this problem, and sure enough -- I wasn't! There's a  great blog post  about a broken migration from MySQL 5 to 8 with Ghost.
texts.text: I figured that I wasn't the first one to stumble into this problem, and sure enough -- I wasn't! There's a  great blog post  about a broken migration from MySQL 5 to 8 with Ghost.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: In short, it required several steps to fix it:
texts.text: In short, it required several steps to fix it:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Stop the Ghost container
texts.text: Stop the Ghost container

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Back up the database first (always a good idea)
texts.text: Back up the database first (always a good idea)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Do a quick find/replace on the dumped database to change the collations
texts.text: Do a quick find/replace on the dumped database to change the collations

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Drop the
texts.text: Drop the

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Import the database back into MySQL
texts.text: Import the database back into MySQL

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Start Ghost again
texts.text: Start Ghost again

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Dropping databases always makes me pause, but that's what backups are for! 😉
texts.text: Dropping databases always makes me pause, but that's what backups are for! 😉

texts.label: title
texts.orig: How I fixed it
texts.text: How I fixed it

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: In my case, my MySQL container is called
texts.text: In my case, my MySQL container is called

texts.label: code
texts.orig: ghostmysql
texts.text: ghostmysql

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: and my Ghost database is
texts.text: and my Ghost database is

texts.label: code
texts.orig: ghostdb
texts.text: ghostdb

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: . Then I made a backup of the database using
texts.text: . Then I made a backup of the database using

texts.label: code
texts.orig: mysqldump
texts.text: mysqldump

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
sudo docker-compose exec ghostmysql mysqldump \
    -u root -psuper-secret-password ghostdb > backup-ghost-db.sql
texts.text:
sudo docker-compose exec ghostmysql mysqldump \
    -u root -psuper-secret-password ghostdb > backup-ghost-db.sql

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Next, I copied the SQL file to another directory  just in case  I accidentally deleted this backup with an errant command.
texts.text: Next, I copied the SQL file to another directory  just in case  I accidentally deleted this backup with an errant command.

texts.label: code
texts.orig: cp backup-ghost-db.sql ../
texts.text: cp backup-ghost-db.sql ../

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Then I made a copy of the SQL file in the current directory and ran the find and replace on that copy. This changes the collations from the wrong one,
texts.text: Then I made a copy of the SQL file in the current directory and ran the find and replace on that copy. This changes the collations from the wrong one,

texts.label: code
texts.orig: utf8mb4_general_ci
texts.text: utf8mb4_general_ci

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: , to the right one,
texts.text: , to the right one,

texts.label: code
texts.orig: utf8mb4_0900_ai_ci
texts.text: utf8mb4_0900_ai_ci

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: [^default_collation]:
texts.text: [^default_collation]:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
cp backup-ghost-db.sql backup-ghost-db-new.sql
sed -i 's/utf8mb4_general_ci/utf8mb4_0900_ai_ci/g' \
    backup-ghost-db-new.sql
texts.text:
cp backup-ghost-db.sql backup-ghost-db-new.sql
sed -i 's/utf8mb4_general_ci/utf8mb4_0900_ai_ci/g' \
    backup-ghost-db-new.sql

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Now I have the collations right for importing the database back into MySQL. But first, I have to drop the existing database. This is a good time to double check your backups!
texts.text: Now I have the collations right for importing the database back into MySQL. But first, I have to drop the existing database. This is a good time to double check your backups!

texts.label: code
paragraph
texts.orig: Now we can import the modified backup:
texts.text: Now we can import the modified backup:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
cat backup-ghost-db-new.sql | sudo docker-compose exec -T \
    ghostmysql mysql -u root -psuper-secret-password ghostdb
texts.text:
cat backup-ghost-db-new.sql | sudo docker-compose exec -T \
    ghostmysql mysql -u root -psuper-secret-password ghostdb

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Start all the containers:
texts.text: Start all the containers:

texts.label: code
texts.orig: sudo docker-compose up -d
texts.text: sudo docker-compose up -d

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Ghost was back online with the older version and everything looked good! I updated my
texts.text: Ghost was back online with the older version and everything looked good! I updated my

texts.label: code
texts.orig: docker-compose.yaml
texts.text: docker-compose.yaml

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: back to use
texts.text: back to use

texts.label: code
texts.orig: latest
texts.text: latest

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: for the Ghost version and ran
texts.text: for the Ghost version and ran

texts.label: code
texts.orig: sudo docker-compose up -d
texts.text: sudo docker-compose up -d

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: once more.
texts.text: once more.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Within seconds, the new container image was in place and the container was running! Both migrations completed in seconds and the blog was back online with the newest version. 🎉
texts.text: Within seconds, the new container image was in place and the container was running! Both migrations completed in seconds and the blog was back online with the newest version. 🎉

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: [^what_theta]: Theta is one of many  financial Greeks  that measure certain aspects of options contracts in the market. It's also a  letter in the Greek alphabet .
texts.text: [^what_theta]: Theta is one of many  financial Greeks  that measure certain aspects of options contracts in the market. It's also a  letter in the Greek alphabet .

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: [^default_collation]: The default collation in MySQL 8 is
texts.text: [^default_collation]: The default collation in MySQL 8 is

texts.label: code
texts.orig: utf8mb4_0900_ai_ci
texts.text: utf8mb4_0900_ai_ci
